issues.body:
Looks like v1.0 of the OpenBadges backpack is hitting the interwebs, and it now offers [an Backpack Connect API](https://github.com/mozilla/openbadges/wiki/Backpack-Connect:-Issuer-Documentation) that allows server-to-server award pushes.

This would be very, very handy to support so that badge earners don't have to manually push every award into the backpack.

issues.title: Consider breaking up django-badger into simpler apps
issues.body:
A little while ago, I merged django-badger-multiplayer into django-badger, because there were some weird hacks needed to keep the two apart. Now, django-badger combines a lot of things in one big app:
- basic views & models for badges & awards
- views to allow users to manage & award their own badges
- [OBI JSON](https://github.com/mozilla/openbadges/wiki/Assertions) representations of badges & awards
- deferred awards with claim codes and email addresses (ie. invitations)
- claim code label printing
- progress tracking models
- nomination models & view

Maybe django-badger should be stripped back down to the bare basics, and I should find a way to split most of the above off into "addon" apps without nasty hacks. 

Some of these features might more properly belong elevated into badges.mozilla.org and not a reusable Django app at all. (eg. like claim code label printing) Or, maybe even something like claim codes could be spun off into its own not-badge-specific Django app.

issues.title: Alert user of just-awarded badges, offer to push to backpack
issues.body: Now that django-badger offers [RecentBadgeAwardsList middleware](https://github.com/lmorchard/django-badger/blob/master/badger/middleware.py#L13), we can check for just-awarded badges whenever a page is loaded. issues.title: Add an explanation textfield for nomination rejection
issues.body: The data model (issue #47) supports a free-form text field to go along with the "reject nomination" button, but the view doesn't use it yet. I haven't quite figured out where to put it that's not totally ugly. Work out where to put it and how to handle submission.

issues.title: Implement "sub-badgers"
issues.body:
Like sub-reddits, this would offer a topical subdomain for badges. This mashes up organizations (#94) and subdomains (#38), possibly. Consider that there could be one or more moderators for the sub-badger, and the sub-badger could be a one-off for an event or long-lived for an organization.

A sub-badger would offer its own set of badges, not listed in the general site or other sub-badgers. Awards would still be per-user, and users would be global.

Needs more thought.

issues.title: Consider restricing characters for tag names
issues.body:
Currently, badges can be given a tag named like `

foo

`. This did trigger an error, which was fixed by [allowing slashes in tag names](https://github.com/lmorchard/django-badger/commit/12e106c60dad84b141db3b198b0e9ddbffb8c186). However, even though the HTML is properly escaped when displayed, we may want to consider rejecting or filtering tag names with what looks like HTML data. But, I'd like to be generous in what's allowed in tag names. Sometimes using slashes, spaces, colons, and other punctuation can be useful in building tagging schemes.

issues.title: Error in migration: badger:0004_auto__add_nomination
Username edits break profile links
issues.body:
On the screen to edit my profile, I can change my username as well as my display name. When I change the username, the links to my profile no longer work, but return a "Page not found" error, as they are putting the old username into the url rather than the new username. 

So when my username is ehenry, the profile is here:
https://badges.allizom.org/en-US/profiles/profile/ehenry/

But when I change my username to be lizzard, many links including the one on the main page at https://badges.allizom.org/en-US/ still go to https://badges.allizom.org/en-US/profiles/profile/ehenry/, while the working profile is now at https://badges.allizom.org/en-US/profiles/profile/lizzard/.

issues.title: Integrate TimelineJS to create visual history of someone's badges
issues.body:
We could integrate TimelineJS to create a visual history of the badges someone has earned.  

http://timeline.verite.co/

This could be a nice way for people to display their badges and can also let us clearly map someone's contributions to what is happening in Mozilla.

For instance, someone's first patch to Firefox could be show along with the date that version of Firefox was released that had that person's code.

Certainly on nomination there should be a comment, and it should be allowed to be public or not. For instance, we have a Roy badge for IT, which is awarded to someone who fixes a problem by "turning it off and on again".
